rukus.text: And people of Moses, after him (in his absence), took (as god) a body of a calf made from their ornaments which made a sound. Did they not see that it does not speak to them and does not guide them to a way? They took it (as god), and they became wrongdoers
And when they regretted and saw that they have made a mistake, they said: if our Master does not have mercy on us and forgive us, we shall be among the losers

When Moses returned to his people, angry and sorrowful, he said: you succeeded me badly after me, were you rushing your Masterâ€™s order? He threw down the tablets and took his brother by the head dragging him toward himself. He (Aaron) said: son of my mother, the people weakened me and almost killed me, so do not make the enemies happy about me, and do not put me with the wrongdoing group
He said: my Master, forgive me and my brother and admit us into Your mercy, and You are the most merciful of the merciful ones
